segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Safety and Hazard Data Message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents that relate to the entire message, e.g. an EEC regulation number, and EPA regulation id, etc.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates, times, and/or periods that are relevant to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the document date.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, that applies to the entire message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the transaction, the contact method(s) and mean(s), and optionally any reference required for a specific party.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. The identity of the party responsible for placing the substances/materials on the market must be identified in accordance with legal requirements. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller of Goods are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents that relate to a specific party, e.g. contract number, order number, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for a trading partner and specifying the communication channel and number. This segment must appear at least once to identify the emergency contact of the goods supplier.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment specifying the communication method, e.g. telephone and means, e.g. telephone number, for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments providing the safety and hazard details of a substance to enable appropriate precautions to be taken. Each occurrence of the detail section relates directly to one Safety Data Sheet, i.e. one substance or product.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment for identifying the start of the data relevant to a specific substance and, where possible, identifying the suppliers product id.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment for identifying or describing the substance. This must be identical to the identification information provided on the label. Other means of identification available may also be given.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional codes to further identify the substance specified in the LIN segment.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the substance to be specified where this is required for full identification.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment enabling any necessary industry/national/ international regulations relating to the substance to be identified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents that relate to the specific product or substance.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date of issue and/or change Safety data.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information relating to the substance is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the transaction, the contact method(s) and mean(s), and optionally any reference required for a specific party.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. The identity of the party responsible for placing substances/materials on the market must be identified in accordance with legal requirements. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller of Goods are known to each other, thus only the coded is required.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents that related to a specific party, e.g. order number, contract number, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for a trading partner and specifying the communication channel and number. This segment must appear at least once to identify the emergency contact of the goods supplier.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment specifying the communication method, e.g. telephone and means e.g. telephone number, for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying the relevant information for one aspect of Safety and Hazard data.

segment.name: Safety information
segment.documentation: SFI, A segment identifying the hazard/safety report section (e.g. one of the 16 sections required by EEC law) or type that the group of segments is associated with.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment identifying the specific substance related to the hazard.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment identifying a type or specific piece of equipment required to handle, store or transport the substance.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information related to the specific hazard is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the transaction, the contact method(s) and mean(s), and optionally any reference required for specific party.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form. The identity of the party responsible for placing the substances/materials on the market must be identified in accordance with legal requirements. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the Buyer and Seller of Goods are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents that relate to a specific party, e.g. order number, contract number, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for a trading partner and specifying the communications channel and number. This segment must appear at least once to identify the emergency contact of the good supplier.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment specifying the communication method, e.g. telephone and means, e.g. telephone number, for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments giving any necessary handling information.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on the handling of hazardous materials.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information related to the handling or storage of the substance is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments providing safety and health hazard information.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment identifying a hazardous component of the substance.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying measurements and tolerances of exposure, storage conditions, etc. for the component.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment specifying the percentage of the hazardous substance that the component occupies.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying documents or regulations relevant to the specific component of the hazardous substance.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information related to the safety or health hazard information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments providing information relating to the transportation of a substance.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment identifying transport related information for the movement of hazardous goods.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying additional documents or regulations relevant to the movement of hazardous goods.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information related to the transport of the hazardous goods is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments providing information relating to the packaging of a substance.

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment describing the type of packages/physical units in which the substance is transported or stored.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment identifying the markings and labels on the packages containing the substance, i.e. the package/box label.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments providing information relating to the physical and chemical characteristics and properties of a substance. When required other related information will be given, e.g. stability, ecological, etc.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment identifying particular characteristic about which information will be required.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment further describing the characteristic of a substance or component of a substance.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information related to the physical of chemical property is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment identifying the value of attributes.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments identifying documents/regulations and, if required, their dates relevant to the characteristic.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying additional documents or regulations relevant to the specific characteristic.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates, times, and/or periods that are relevant for the document or regulation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments providing measurements and test results related to the substances physical and chemical property.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying the physical/chemical property measurements, e.g. melting point, boiling point, etc.

segment.name: Test method
segment.documentation: TEM, A segment specifying the type and nature of the test performed to obtain the measurement.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time/period when the test result was obtained.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying documents or regulations relevant to the specific test result.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with text information, in coded or clear form, used to give additional information relating to the test.
